title: Napoli chairman warns Jose Callejon and Dries Mertens against leaving for a move to China
text:
Dries Mertens and Jose Callejon have been told that the grass won't necessarily be greener on the other side should they leave Napoli at the end of the season.

That's the view of the club's chairman Aurelio De Laurentiis who has strongly warned them to think twice about moving to China.

The duo have been linked with moves to the Far East once their Napoli contracts expire this summer - with the vast financial riches over there having lured top players before.

Napoli duo Jose Callejon (left) and Dries Mertens have been warned against a move to China

Napoli chairman Aurelio De Laurentiis says the pair would be 'overpaid to live a life of s***'

And with speculation over their next contracts continuing, De Laurentiis believes the pair would be 'sellouts' if they swapped top-level European football for that in China just to be 'overpaid to live a life of s*** for two or three years'.

'I'm absolutely not prepared to make a major effort for them,' he told Sky Sport Italia.

'Each player has a value, depending on where they play, how they play, how old they are and what they do.

'If they want to sell themselves out in China, overpaid to live a life of s*** for two or three years, it's their problem.

Callejon has made nine appearances for the Italian giants so far this season in all competitions

'I can't consider China to be competitive. China's far away. If they consider it to be close, it's their problem.

'In life, you have to choose whether to be happy and find a job you enjoy doing or work just for money.

'For me, money is a means and not an end; if it's an end for them then they should go to China.'

Mertens and Callejon have been regulars in the Napoli first-team this season, having made eight and nine appearances so far this season. The former has scored six goals in that time, while Callejon has just the one strike to date.
description: Dries Mertens and Jose Callejon have been told that the grass won't necessarily be greener on the other side should they leave Napoli at the end of the season.
